alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:02PM CDT until April 28 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Dunn and Pepin Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers as additional rainfall from tonight and into Friday will keep river flows increased. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, APRIL 28... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until Friday, April 28. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Highway 10 on the north approach to the bridge across the Chippewa River may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 13.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Thursday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage next Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 04/14/1965. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
